concise_definition: n. 船难, 沉船; v. 使沉没, 毁坏

definitions.explanation_en: The destruction of a ship due to accident, storm, or collision, often resulting in its sinking and loss of cargo or lives.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指船只因事故、风暴或碰撞而遭受毁灭，通常导致沉没以及货物或人员的损失。
definitions.example_en: The crew survived the shipwreck after clinging to debris for three days.
definitions.example_cn: 船员在抓住残骸漂浮了三天后幸存下来。

definitions.explanation_en: The remains of a sunken ship, often found on the ocean floor and studied by archaeologists.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指沉没船只的残骸，常位于海底，由考古学家进行研究。
definitions.example_en: Divers explored the ancient shipwreck off the coast of Greece.
definitions.example_cn: 潜水员探索了希腊海岸外的古代沉船。

definitions.explanation_en: To cause a ship to be destroyed or sunk, typically through accident or natural disaster.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指因事故或自然灾害导致船只被毁或沉没。
definitions.example_en: The storm shipwrecked three fishing vessels near the reef.
definitions.example_cn: 风暴在礁石附近使三艘渔船沉没。

definitions.explanation_en: To ruin or destroy something completely, especially a plan, relationship, or endeavor, often metaphorically.
definitions.explanation_cn: 比喻性地指彻底毁坏某事物，尤其是计划、关系或事业。
definitions.example_en: His reckless spending shipwrecked his financial future.
definitions.example_cn: 他挥霍无度，毁掉了自己的财务未来。

comparison.analysis: “Crash” (碰撞/坠毁) 通常指高速撞击导致的突然破坏，多用于车辆、飞机或系统故障，强调冲击力和瞬间性。而 “shipwreck” 专指船只因海难而沉没，具有特定的海洋语境和更持久的后果，如残骸留存。
“Sinking” (下沉) 是一个中性描述，仅指物体因进水或失衡而逐渐沉入水下，不必然导致毁灭。而 “shipwreck” 不仅包含下沉，更强调灾难性后果，如人员伤亡、货物全损或结构彻底解体。
“Disaster” (灾难) 是一个泛指重大破坏性事件的词，可涵盖地震、火灾、战争等。而 “shipwreck” 是一种具体的灾难类型，专指与船舶相关的毁灭事件，语义范围更窄、更具体。
